results.title: Edward Presley: a man of assurance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
Edward Presley is one of the many people employed by Lloyds of London. This film examines the history and present day operations of the largest insurance company in the world. Narrated by James Mason

results.title: A New vision
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A short series of films about great artists which aims to entertain and excite audience attention as well as to inform, by blending computer animation and graphics, traditional animation and, where appropriate, live action with shots of the works under discussion.

results.title: The Swimmer
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
Presents aspects of the sport of swimming in Australia, in particular the physical and psychological preparation of champion Australian swimmers for the 1970 Commonwealth Games. Coaches Forbes Carlile and Don Talbot and swimmers Karen Moras and Diana Rickard are seen at work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Smith, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Athletes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain.
results.description:

results.title: Soccer [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
Australians play several types of football - Aussie Rules, Rugby League, Rugby Union and Soccer. Soccer, however, is the fastest growing game of them all. More and more Australians are beginning to think in terms of soccer. This film tells the story of soccer in Australia, from nursery teams of three-year-olds, right through junior and club football, to international sides that are beginning to show signs of promise. Italian language commentary.

results.title: Soccer
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
Looks at soccer in Australia, concentrating mainly on the coaching of young players to learn the game. Also shows Australia’s international team in action.
